name: NPR
text: The rallies, the crowd and the theatrics are straight out of his 2016 playbook. But after nearly four years in office, he's no longer the outsider, and is being judged on his handling of a pandemic that has killed 225,000 Americans. https://t.co/X0osppu0hd

name: NPR
text:
By the time he left the presidency, Theodore Roosevelt had saved an unprecedented 230 million acres of American land. 

David Gessner's new book, "Leave It As It Is," traces Roosevelt's crusading environmental legacy. @hereandnow
https://t.co/VoOuZYEjXX

name: NPR
text:
Massachusetts nursing homes were hit early and especially hard by the pandemic, and a @WBUR analysis finds more diverse nursing homes had higher COVID-19 death rates than predominantly white facilities.
 https://t.co/Ps3mhcf556

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic is hitting Latinx women harder than any other group. They're facing higher infection rates, and many are losing their jobs or work hours.

As a result, a growing number say they're motivated to vote for Biden, recent Pew polling data show. https://t.co/NRyTglmoko

name: NPR
text: Europe reported more than 1.3 million new cases this past week, its highest single week count yet. https://t.co/zqEoihsfn1

name: NPR
text:
Ellis Cose: "When you go into the current administration, you have an administration that doesn't even believe in truth ...  And what we now have [is] an entire government apparatus designed to foster falsehoods."
https://t.co/HXhw27e7QM

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúAs a reporter, I am trained not to intervene in the lives of my subjects ‚Äì but given the no-home-birth policy in the Philippines, I felt I had to offer to bring her to the hospital.‚Äù 

Read Xyza Cruz Bacani‚Äôs story and see her moving photos:
https://t.co/DYquZurOXb

name: NPR
text:
A Pulitzer Prize-winning composer has designed a GPS-enabled music app to accompany walks around Central Park. What you hear depends on the route you take ‚Äî and how long you stand in certain places.
https://t.co/AVePNm7D8h

name: NPR
text: Even as the WNBA weathered a busy, unpredictable season in the "wubble," Seattle Storm superstar Sue Bird carried on her colleagues' commitment to social justice activism. https://t.co/A3AHJ9LQ5Q

name: NPR
text:
"Wachito Rico" ‚Äî Chilean slang for "handsome boy" ‚Äî is @soypablo777's first full-length album since his splash onto the indie-pop scene in 2017.

NPR spoke with the 21-year-old musician about it:
 https://t.co/VBEXwIkKk7

name: NPR
text:
Cafe con Libros in Brooklyn provides for the community in ways that Amazon can't ‚Äî such as supplying space for folks to learn and grow. 

And because of that community investment, owner Kalima DeSuze is confident her store will get through the pandemic. https://t.co/g2ov9rqY8z

name: NPR
text:
More than 8.6 million coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the United States.

Here's how much cases are up compared with 2 weeks ago:

üìà North Dakota: +54%
üìà South Dakota: +43%
üìà Montana: +24%
üìà Wisconsin: +82%
üìà Guam: +62%
https://t.co/ojX9Obifjm

name: NPR
text:
We're in the home stretch of the presidential race.

Here are some things to watch in the final week:

‚Ä¢ where campaigns are investing
‚Ä¢ poll tightening (or expansion)
‚Ä¢ how Senate candidates talk about Trump
‚Ä¢ early vote totals
‚Ä¢ surprises
https://t.co/50aX1GAY4X

name: NPR
text:
A police officer who shot and killed Marcellis Stinnette and injured Tafara Williams last week in Waukegan, Ill., has been fired.

City officials are expected to release police video of the encounter as soon as this week.
https://t.co/ahgv4Xbzqu

name: NPR
text:
There are about 13.6 million single parents, mostly moms, raising kids across the U.S. right now.

And with Congress still unable to pass a relief bill, many collecting unemployment are now running out of money to pay rent.
https://t.co/2ITofGN9jA

name: NPR
text:
Military officials tell NPR they want to maintain their apolitical stance and not get involved in partisan politics ‚Äî saying uniformed soldiers at the polls would lead to charges that the military favors one candidate over another.
https://t.co/ctcG31Wiu0

name: NPR
text:
The Trump campaign now sees that it is conservative Catholics, not white evangelicals, who hold the key to his reelection ‚Äî at least in the hotly contested swing states.
https://t.co/DiqpbHsO9Z

name: NPR
text:
People infected with the novel coronavirus shed virus particles in their poop.

Now, more and more colleges are testing wastewater from dorms in an effort to identify infections and monitor the spread.
https://t.co/AIZm4CjZld

name: NPR
text:
Moon water, get your moon water here!

NASA has confirmed the presence of water on the moon's sunlit surface. https://t.co/0g5q4zQC8m
